organization.description: A group for Linking Open Data datasets. The initial import of data for this group was done in October 2009 from the list of [RDF datasets dumps](http://esw.w3.org/DataSetRDFDumps) provided by the W3C Linking Open Data Interest Group.
organization.title: Linking Open Data
organization.name: lod

name: heml
notes:
### Title: Historical Event Markup Language

### Description

Historical Event Markup and Linking Project (Heml) provides an XML schema for historical events and a Java Web app which transforms conforming documents into hyperlinked timelines, maps and tables. It aims to provide a most information-rich interchange format for historical data, and thus add a historical component to the growing movement for a 'Semantic Web.'

For our purposes main item of interest is the data provided with the project available from: <http://heml.mta.ca/releases/Rdf/Heml/>. About 30 timelines in the form of RDF files on historical themes ranging from Alexander the Great to the Meiji Restoration.

### License

No explicit license on the data as far as one can tell so license decision based on <http://freshmeat.net/projects/heml/>.
title: Historical Events Markup Language
